dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 1214 IH: To require the name of military installation under jurisdiction of Secretary of the Army located in Fayetteville, North Carolina, to be known and designated as Fort Bragg, and for other purposes.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Self introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Armed Services

form.official-title: To require the name of military installation under jurisdiction of Secretary of the Army located in Fayetteville, North Carolina, to be known and designated as Fort Bragg, and for other purposes.

section.header: Name of military installation under jurisdiction of Secretary of the Army located in Fayetteville, North Carolina

subsection.text: The military installation under the jurisdiction of the Secretary of the Army located in Fayetteville, North Carolina, shall after the date of the enactment of this Act be known and designated as Fort Bragg. Any reference to such military installation in any law, regulation, map, document, record, or other paper of the United States shall be considered to be a reference to Fort Bragg.
In this section, the term military installation has the meaning given such term in section 2801 of title 10, United States Code.
